The House majority owes America a budget and transparency, and not the continued drumbeat towards impeachment. America’s best interests are not being served.”

“For the eight years Republicans held the Majority in the House we passed a budget. But, this time the Majority wants to mask huge increases in domestic spending combined with cuts to our nation’s defense.
“Hate for the President should not drive the House Majority’s agenda. They are not solving problems, not passing budgets, and not reaching across the aisle to deliver results for the American people.
This bill also allows the Speaker to continue targeting the President without requiring approval from the House with the goal of protecting vulnerable members of her party on taking key votes.
Even though they reached a deal just yesterday, gaining access to see what Rep. Nadler called ‘Robert Mueller’s most important files,’ they still brought this to a vote.
Today, the Majority brought H. Res 430 for a vote, which gives the Judiciary Committee the authority to enforce subpoenas issued against AG Bill Barr and former White House Counsel Don McGahn.

“We will be voting on major appropriations bills this week, but we have not yet voted on a full budget, which is the duty of Congress. Instead, the Majority is focused on harassing the President and a continuing to push towards impeachment.
Thank you Ma’am.
